text:
Changes related to #1057 are ok. But there are quite a few cosmetic changes (period missing in html, etc) that are not related to this issue.
I would be in favor of removing those changes and create a PR for fixing them.

> @aabadie OK I will try to do this asap.

@Naereen, waiting for your update :)
@Naereen, I'll merge this. Thanks !
Many thanks for taking care of that.
The checks passed. Can you merge it?
OK for merging. One more review ?

perhaps even "$USER$" in each respective row?

text:
Well it is still a _"fake"_ display, so it won't really change anything.
On Python, $USER has no meaning by the way, I don't think it improves readability (which was the only reason for my change `varoquau/dev/nilearn` → `user`).

Hmm, the change is a bit frightening. I thinks that its is because the test that was discussed in that script actually refers to another script, namely `plot_haxby_anova_svm.py`.
So the change is right, never mind.

text: Funny how [both indices and indexes](http://www.nasdaqomx.com/transactions/indexes/indexesorindices/) are valid, but I changed it to a non existing spelling... I will correct that.
title: (None, '', u'doc/decoding/decoding_tutorial.rst')

text: In fact, I suspect that the doctest was written and never tested (as it has a `doctest: +SKIP` flag), and that this score of 100% was just written in the rST documentation file, not computed from a real experiment.
title: (329, '', u'doc/decoding/decoding_tutorial.rst')

text:
Sorry, I was unclear.
The line that you're rightly replacing corresponds to another script: plot_haxby_anova_svm.py.
in the context of this tutorial, the classification rate is what you got, no question about that.
So, I'm fine with the change.
